keywords.indexterm: Oxygen XML Web Author ComponentEmbed in a CMS page

body.p: can be embedded in a CMS to offer editing functionality for documents stored in the CMS.
To embed , load the main page (app/oxygen.html) in an iframe.

section.title: Security Restrictions
section.p: uses cookies to enforce its licensing and to maintain the editing state of the opened documents. Some browsers block third-party cookies for security reasons. To avoid having the cookies blocked, should be served from the same origin as the CMS host page.

section.title: Passing Parameters to the Editor
section.p: To control the editor, you can use URL parameters described in the options section. To pass custom parameters, you can implement a plugin for that contains JavaScript code to interpret those parameters.

section.title: Communicating with the Editor
section.p: To communicate with the editor, you can send messages between the host CMS page and the page.

Browsers offer the window.postMessage JavaScript API that allows messages to be sent between pages. To receive the message, create a plugin for that contains JavaScript code that listens for the messages sent by the CMS host page and uses the JavaScript API to implement the required functionality.

ul.li: We experienced problems if the iframe is hidden while loading using display: none. You can use visibility: hidden for the same purpose.

Some XML vocabularies (for example, DITA) support cross-document links. By default, clicking on a cross-document link will open that document in the in another browser tab. If the editor is embedded, you may want to change this behavior using the sync.api.Editor.EventTypes.LINK_OPENED event that is triggered on the sync.api.Editor instance.
